sentences.en: All consultations are by appointment only .
All consultations are by appointment only.
At the time, his appointment seemed a stroke of genius.
sentences.cn: 当时，对他的任命犹如神来之笔。

sentences.en: Drake and his cohorts were not pleased with my appointment.
sentences.cn: 德雷克那一帮人对我的任命很不满。

sentences.en: He secured the appointment of professor of English literature in the university.
sentences.cn: 他获聘为该大学的英国文学教授.

sentences.en: I fixed up an appointment to see her.
I have an appointment at the doctors.
I have an appointment with him at four o'clock.
sentences.cn: 我和他四点钟有个约会.

sentences.en: I've got an appointment I can't wriggle out of.
sentences.cn: 我有个推脱不掉的约会.

sentences.en: In some cases people have had to wait several weeks for an appointment.
sentences.cn: 在某些情况下，人们必须等上好几周才能得到约见。

sentences.en: Other changes included the appointment of a new Foreign Minister.
sentences.cn: 其他变动包括任命了一位新的外交部长。

sentences.en: She arranged an appointment for Friday afternoon at four-fifteen.
sentences.cn: 她在星期五下午4点15分安排了一次会面。

sentences.en: She has an appointment with her accountant.
sentences.cn: 她和她的会计约好了见面。

sentences.en: She sounded upset when I said you couldn't give her an appointment.
sentences.cn: 我告诉她你不能安排与她会面时，她的声音听上去有些沮丧。

sentences.en: The appointment was put off because of his illness.
sentences.cn: 由于他生病而推迟了约会.
未经预约，谢绝参观（或来访）。

words.tran_cn: 任命；指定；约定时间，地点（appoint 的过去分词形式）

phrases.tran_cn: （英国） 女王陛下御用（制造商的产品宣传用语，宣称女王系其客户，以示其产品质量有保证）
(律)（由财产所有人授予的）财产处置权

trans.tran_en: an arrangement for a meeting at an agreed time and place, for a particular purpose
